solution.text:
area of unshaded part of the quadrant(QPO)=area(OQO'P)- area[sector(O'QP)]
area[sector(OQP)]=\(\frac 14 \times \pi \times R^2\)
area[sector(O'QP)]=_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j/4,2)}}_
area of the square(OQO'P)=\(OP^2=r^2=_{j}_^2\)
area of unshaded part of the quadrant(QPO)\(=_{j}_^2-_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j/4,2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(j*j-(pi_val*j*j)/4,2)}}_\)
Similary area of unshaded part of the quadrant(QPO')=area(OQOP)- area[sector(OQP)]
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(j*j-pi_val*j*j/4,2)}}_\)
Hence area in common(shaded area)= area (OQO'P)-total unshaded area in the quadrants
area in common(shaded area)=_{{j*j}}_ - _{{trunc(2*pi_val*j*j/4,2)}}_
\(\Rightarrow_{{trunc((2*pi_val*j*j/4)-j*j,2)}}_\)

content.text:
Quadrants of two circles overlap each other as shown in the figure.
If both the circles have equal radius, \(r_1=r_2=_{j}_cm\), find the area in common
